newsitem.title: ITALY: Fiat's Agnelli says slight EMU delay not tragic.
newsitem.headline: Fiat's Agnelli says slight EMU delay not tragic.

text.p: Giovanni Agnelli, honorary chairman of Fiat, Italy's largest industrial group, said a slight delay to Italy's entry into European economic and monetary union would not be "a tragedy."
"Everyone wants to join EMU, but one must bear in mind that if in 1998 they put (our entry) off a bit it won't be a tragedy," he told reporters while attending a meeting of Fiat managers in Turin.

The lira rejoined the European currency grid at the weekend after a four-year absence and the government has drawn up a tough budget designed to cut 62.5 trillion lire off next year's deficit and help Italy join EMU from the planned 1999 start.
German Bundesbank council member Reimut Jochimsen said on Wednesday that if not enough countries qualify for EMU in 1988, a delay in starting currency union should not be ruled out.
